column2: Prepending a backslash to an ordinary character in a string does not have any effect, and may make regular expressions constructed from this string behave unexpectedly.
column4: The escape sequence '\s' is equivalent to just 's', so the sequence is not a character class when it is used in a [["regular expression"|"relative:///VulnFinder-CodeQL-main/src/javascript-cwe/CWE-020/examples/UselessRegExpCharacterEscape_bad_1.js:1:24:1:46"]].
